duties_responsibilities.duty: Monitoring all tasks necessary to accomplish payroll processing objectives, including relationships with external vendors and state and federal agencies.
Planning, coordinating, and managing the functions of the payroll department.
Administering payroll operations for all full-time, part-time, and temporary employees, including rectifying inaccuracies and ensuring compliance with regulations.
Managing, entering, scheduling, and maintaining employee data in a payroll management system, including new hires, terminations, rate changes, and benefit deductions.
Preparing monthly, quarterly, and biweekly payroll reports to CFO, HR, Benefits, and Finance team.
Overseeing biweekly payroll activities, voiding checks, distributing paychecks, and ensuring proper employee classification.
Managing payroll specialist(s) to ensure timely and accurate biweekly payroll processing.
Reviewing tax reports and payments, overseeing unemployment eligibility claims, and wage/employment verifications.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in finance, HR, or related field (Master's preferred)
CPP certification or ability to obtain it within the first year of employment
